result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd M Marsh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Defendant Todd M Marsh in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Todd M Marsh in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation. Defendant makes statement. 

Court relates and orders: 
Count 1 - 3 yrs in the WI State Prison system with 1 yr 6 months initial confinement and 1 yr 6 months extended supervision - consecutive to 11CF280.
Count 2 - 3 yrs in the WI State Prison system with 1 yr 6 months initial confinement and 1 yr 6 months extended supervision - consecutive to all other counts.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Defendant is not eligible for the substance abuse program or challenge incarceration.
Court costs + DNA surcharge.
0 days credit
